MFTask Class Reference

Encapsulates an NSTask providing easy capture of output via its delegate Provides an API for NSTask objects that is more similar to NSURLConnection. All output from the task can easily be captured via the delegate methods defined in MFTaskDelegateProtocol. MFTask objects accept a tag so that a delegate can recognise output from multiple tasks. Although a standard input pipe can be set, the standard output and standard input are managed internally. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

(void) - terminate
 Terminates the task If called on a task that has not been launched, this method will ensure that the isFinished flag is set, which invalidates the task for further use.
(BOOL) - isRunning
 Whether the underlying task is running. See the corresponding method of NSTask.
(BOOL) - launch
 Attempts to Launch the Task. Returns NO if it fails An exception is thrown if this method is called on a task that has already launched, or a task that has been terminated.

 A Tag that can be used to identify an MFTask.
id< MFTaskDelegateProtocol > delegate
 A delegate object that conforms to the MFTaskDelegateProtocol.
BOOL isFinished
 A flag indicating whether this MFTask has finished execution. This flag will be set to YES under the following conditions.
BOOL hasLaunched
 A flag indicating whether the task has launched. Set to true when launch is called.

Detailed Description

Encapsulates an NSTask providing easy capture of output via its delegate Provides an API for NSTask objects that is more similar to NSURLConnection. All output from the task can easily be captured via the delegate methods defined in MFTaskDelegateProtocol. MFTask objects accept a tag so that a delegate can recognise output from multiple tasks. Although a standard input pipe can be set, the standard output and standard input are managed internally.

Member Function Documentation

- (BOOL) launch  

Attempts to Launch the Task. Returns NO if it fails An exception is thrown if this method is called on a task that has already launched, or a task that has been terminated.

Returns:
YES if launch was successful. Otherwise no.

Property Documentation

- (BOOL) isFinished [read, write, assign]

A flag indicating whether this MFTask has finished execution. This flag will be set to YES under the following conditions.

1. After the internal NSTask sends it NSTaskDidTerminateNotification and then after all output and error data has been read
2. If the MFTask is terminated via a call to terminate without ever having been launched.
